qas.question: When did Burke leave the Whig party?
Who did Burke turn down money from?
What did Burke say 'envenoms everything it touches'?
Who thought that Fox and Burke could still be friends?
Who thought that Fox and Burke's friendship was lost?
Who declined taking money from Burke?
When did Burke leave the party?
Who kept their friend at the cost of their duty?

plausible_answers.text: that envenoms every thing it touches

qas.question: What did Fox say about the French constitution?
Who overcame his emotions in order to finish his speech?

context: At this point, <a3_0>Fox<a3_0/> whispered that there was "no loss of friendship". "I regret to say there is", <a4_0><b7_0>Burke<b7_0/><a4_0/> replied, "I have indeed made a great sacrifice; I have done my duty though I have lost my friend. There is something in the detested <a2_0>French constitution<a2_0/> <b8_0>that envenoms every thing it touches<b8_0/>". This provoked a reply from <b9_0>Fox<b9_0/>, yet he was unable to give his speech for some time since he was overcome with tears and emotion, he appealed to Burke to remember their inalienable friendship, but also repeated his criticisms of Burke and uttered "unusually bitter sarcasms". This only aggravated the rupture between the two men. Burke demonstrated his separation from the party on <a0_0><b6_0>5 June 1791<b6_0/><a0_0/> by writing to <a1_0><b5_0>Fitzwilliam<b5_0/><a1_0/>, declining money from him.
